2023 年 11 月 11 日星期六 14:00:48 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
灵性与气候变化的意想不到的联系|戈帕尔·D·帕特尔戈帕尔·D·帕特尔Environmental activist Gopal D. Patel thinks the climate movement could learn a lot from one of the longest-standing social initiatives in human history: religion. Exploring three areas where frameworks from faith traditions could benefit the climate movement, Patel offers a playbook for discovering your big idea to build momentum towards powerful social change.灵性与气候变化的意想不到的联系|戈帕尔·D·帕特尔Environmental activist Gopal D. 是时候重新思考第一夫人的角色了 |伊琳娜·卡拉马诺斯·阿德里安伊琳娜·卡拉马诺斯·阿德里安Irina Karamanos Adrian didn't plan on becoming Chile's First Lady — but she set out to transform the role all the same. 人工智能竞争的阴暗面 |丽芙·博瑞丽芙·博瑞Competition is a core part of human nature, and it can drive us to extraordinary feats. But when it goes wrong, the results can be devastating. Poker champion and science communicator Liv Boeree introduces us to "Moloch's trap" — the dark force of game theory driving many of humanity's biggest social problems, which is now threatening to derail the AI industry.人工智能竞争的阴暗面 |丽芙·博瑞Competition is a core part of human nature, and it can drive us to extraordinary feats. But when it goes wrong, the results can be devastating. Poker champion and science communicator Liv Boeree introduces us to "Moloch's trap" — the dark force of game theory driving many of humanity's biggest social problems, which is now threatening to derail the AI industry. https://www.ted.com/talks/liv_boeree_the_dark_side_of_competition_in_ai?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:119915 119915 Wed, 08 Nov 2023 15:52:52 +0000高等教育不00:11:59泰德
超越人类感知极限的自然摄影 |多丽丝·米奇多丽丝·米奇Artist Doris Mitsch invites us to revel in the wonders of nature through her dazzling photography: stacked images of starlings in flight, hawks surfing thermal updrafts, bats echolocating through the night sky and more. Revealing the hidden trails created by creatures in flight, her work offers unique insight into the intelligence behind nature's invisible rhythms.超越人类感知极限的自然摄影 |多丽丝·米奇Artist Doris Mitsch invites us to revel in the wonders of nature through her dazzling photography: stacked images of starlings in flight, hawks surfing thermal updrafts, bats echolocating through the night sky and more. Revealing the hidden trails created by creatures in flight, her work offers unique insight into the intelligence behind nature's invisible rhythms. https://www.ted.com/talks/doris_mitsch_photographing_nature_beyond_the_limits_of_ human_perception?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:119218 119218 Tue, 07 Nov 2023 16:00:19 +0000高等教育不00:05:47泰德
技术是我们的救世主，还是我们的杀手？ |鲁哈·本杰明鲁哈·本杰明When it comes to technology, we're often presented with two contrasting visions of the future: one where technology fulfills all our desires, and another where it leads to chaos and conflict. Sociologist Ruha Benjamin is here with a more radical vision of the future — one where humanity isn't saved or slayed by technology, but rather uses it to uplift ordinary people and make things like health care and housing for all a reality.技术是我们的救世主，还是我们的杀手？ |鲁哈·本杰明When it comes to technology, we're often presented with two contrasting visions of the future: one where technology fulfills all our desires, and another where it leads to chaos and conflict. Sociologist Ruha Benjamin is here with a more radical vision of the future — one where humanity isn't saved or slayed by technology, but rather uses it to uplift ordinary people and make things like health care and housing for all a reality. https://www.ted.com/talks/ruha_benjamin_is_technology_our_savior_or_our_slayer?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:119531 119531 Mon, 06 Nov 2023 16:00:11 +0000高等教育不00:11:49泰德
重生可以恢复破碎的世界|保罗·霍肯保罗·霍肯A frog and a mockingbird changed Paul Hawken's life, kindling a devotion to protect and restore nature. Now, as one of the world's preeminent environmentalists, he advocates for regeneration — a calling and action plan for the world to come together to end the climate crisis in one generation and put life at the center of every decision we make.重生可以恢复破碎的世界|保罗·霍肯A frog and a mockingbird changed Paul Hawken's life, kindling a devotion to protect and restore nature. 人造皮肤？我们成功了——原因如下 |安娜·玛丽亚·科克莱特安娜·玛丽亚·科克莱特Material scientist Anna Maria Coclite unveils "smart skin" — artificial skin technology that responds to touch, temperature and humidity like your very own. (It's actually even more sensitive than human skin!) From helping burn victims to paving the way to smarter, safer humanoid robots, Coclite highlights the broad-ranging potential of this innovation.人造皮肤？我们成功了——原因如下 |安娜·玛丽亚·科克莱特Material scientist Anna Maria Coclite unveils "smart skin" — artificial skin technology that responds to touch, temperature and humidity like your very own. 回收全球电池的强大可能性|艾玛·尼伦海姆艾玛·尼伦海姆The world has plenty of clean energy. The problem is storing that energy and getting it where we need it, when we need it, says battery recycling pioneer Emma Nehrenheim. While batteries are fundamental to powering a sustainable future, their production is surprisingly harsh on the environment. She lays out the science behind a breakthrough in recycling a battery's core elements, offering a manufacturing solution that could vastly reduce the industry's environmental impact and demand for new materials from mining.回收全球电池的强大可能性|艾玛·尼伦海姆The world has plenty of clean energy. The problem is storing that energy and getting it where we need it, when we need it, says battery recycling pioneer Emma Nehrenheim. While batteries are fundamental to powering a sustainable future, their production is surprisingly harsh on the environment. She lays out the science behind a breakthrough in recycling a battery's core elements, offering a manufacturing solution that could vastly reduce the industry's environmental impact and demand for new materials from mining. https://www.ted.com/talks/emma_nehrenheim_the_powerful_possibilities_of_recycling_the_world_s_batteries?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118063 118063 Thu, 02 Nov 2023 14:54:53 +0000高等教育不00:09:47泰德
非传统思维的力量 |大卫·麦克威廉姆斯大卫·麦克威廉姆斯From World War I to the 2008 economic collapse and beyond, history shows that economists don't always see the future as clearly as they think they do, says economist David McWilliams. Using the words of W.B. Yeats, McWilliams makes the case for embracing unconventional thinkers – poets, artists and musicians – and offers a creative path towards a world filled with less confirmation bias and more understanding.非传统思维的力量 |大卫·麦克威廉姆斯From World War I to the 2008 economic collapse and beyond, history shows that economists don't always see the future as clearly as they think they do, says economist David McWilliams. Using the words of W.B. Yeats, McWilliams makes the case for embracing unconventional thinkers – poets, artists and musicians – and offers a creative path towards a world filled with less confirmation bias and more understanding. https://www.ted.com/talks/david_mcwilliams_the_power_of_unconventional_thinking?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118062 118062 Wed, 01 Nov 2023 14:58:28 +0000高等教育不00:18:06泰德
人工智能很危险，但原因并不像你想象的那样 |萨莎·卢奇奥尼萨莎·卢奇奥尼AI won't kill us all — but that doesn't make it trustworthy. Instead of getting distracted by future existential risks, AI ethics researcher Sasha Luccioni thinks we need to focus on the technology's current negative impacts, like emitting carbon, infringing copyrights and spreading biased information. She offers practical solutions to regulate our AI-filled future — so it's inclusive and transparent.人工智能很危险，但原因并不像你想象的那样 |萨莎·卢奇奥尼AI won't kill us all — but that doesn't make it trustworthy. Instead of getting distracted by future existential risks, AI ethics researcher Sasha Luccioni thinks we need to focus on the technology's current negative impacts, like emitting carbon, infringing copyrights and spreading biased information. She offers practical solutions to regulate our AI-filled future — so it's inclusive and transparent. https://www.ted.com/talks/sasha_luccioni_ai_is_dangerous_but_not_for_the_reasons_you_think?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:119420 119420 Tue, 31 Oct 2023 14:46:53 +0000高等教育不00:10:15泰德
